snippet.textDisplay:
I refuse to accept this,

Imo the Cell saga is the worst part to end the series, I never cared for it, it always seemed like almost a filler arc to me. I understand the narrative importance of Freeza as an end point, going out and defeating the intergalactic overlord that destroyed your species by fulfilling an ancient prophesy that the prince of all saiyans couldn't fulfill? Sure.

I get Buu as a final story arc, defeating the eldritch abomination that has been a universal threat since the dawn of time with Vegeta completing his story arc (which is really the story of DB imo, Vegeta and Goku) ending with the universe together sacrificing their power to help Vegeta and Goku fight on a lonely planet out in space, ending with the greatest thumbs up in anime History? Goku telling Vegeta they make a good team, something Vegeta told Goku when they first met? Sign me up.

Ending with freaking gohan defeating a minor villain who barely wiped out a few towns in a karate match by using the most anti-climactic failure of a transformation ever? I don't see it. I can understand the concept of ending it with an amalgamation of all their greatest foes throughout the years....IF that had been done correctly and had had any real narrative implementation.

This will leave a hole in my life, something unfinished, take a 10 year Hiatus, it's fine, but don't take away my hope. The cell saga is my least favorite DB saga, and Buu just felt like the perfect ending for DB, and even more so, dbza.

snippet.textDisplay:
Guilty confession, I got choked up. Gentlemen, you made the right call. A certain other parody series comes to mind while watching this. It was new and sharp, brilliant and addictive until after WAY too many seasons, it beat itself into oblivion. I stopped watching once I realized the plot would never wrap up. You haven't made that mistake. What you DID do is take something we all grew up loving, excellent in its own right, and managed to make it raw material that you then the worked and polished into something somehow new. And what you created is outstanding. With no blockbuster budget you kept me entertained for a decade. Well done.


Now smile or I'm gonna go get the KITTEN, and he's gonna BEAT YOU UP!!

snippet.textDisplay: Tbh Its a good thing dbza is over. This is probably an unpopular opinion but I always thaught the comedic value of the series started decreasing in the last few episodes. Dont get me wrong it was still very much enjoyable to watch and the quality of the production and detail in the script was amazing, even better than past seasons. However it did not go unnoticed how much work it took you guys to release episodes and keep them up. Reading posts about it on reddit just showed how tough the situation was on some of tfs' members, maybe this repercuted on some level on the comedy aspect of the show. I think this is the best choice for the show's legacy and for TFS' health in general. Episode 60 ended on a brilliant note anyway. We can only thank you guys for the work and sacrifices you put into this project because it really became piece of joy for some of us at times. best of luck boys

snippet.textDisplay:
Come on Team Four Star, you can still do it! You may not have it in yourselves to do a whole new season, but here's my idea: make A LAST 1 HOUR EPISODE OF THE BUU SAGA . Please don't give up now! You came this far and you are so close to end an amazing project in the greatest way. It won't be a "last season of Scrubs" thing. Imagine it as a last effort to conclude a path that you've been walking along for years (almost like the Snake Way to King Kai's planet ;) ).
Did Goku ever give up the 99th day of training at 100x gravity? NO! Did Vegeta ever give up one push up before reaching Super Saiyan? NO! Did Yamcha ever give up... ok bad example.
Anyway, 1 last episode (: 1 hour or so for the full Buu saga. And then we can say goodbye, like Goku flying away with Uub. You can still do it, and overcome the fear of failure. 'Cause

You can't surrender at the turning point of destiny
Right now, it's do or die, our laughs are on the line, and you will not flee
By your power!

snippet.textOriginal:
Come on Team Four Star, you can still do it! You may not have it in yourselves to do a whole new season, but here's my idea: make *A LAST 1 HOUR EPISODE OF THE BUU SAGA* . Please don't give up now! You came this far and you are so close to end an amazing project in the greatest way. It won't be a "last season of Scrubs" thing. Imagine it as a last effort to conclude a path that you've been walking along for years (almost like the Snake Way to King Kai's planet ;) ).
Did Goku ever give up the 99th day of training at 100x gravity? NO! Did Vegeta ever give up one push up before reaching Super Saiyan? NO! Did Yamcha ever give up... ok bad example. 
Anyway, *1 last episode* (: 1 hour or so for the full Buu saga. And then we can say goodbye, like Goku flying away with Uub. You can still do it, and overcome the fear of failure. 'Cause

You can't surrender at the turning point of destiny
Right now, it's do or die, our laughs are on the line, and you will not flee
By your power!
Whoa-oah! It's clear to me
Your spirit grows and you will face this demon
Whoa! With burning energy
The finale of DBZA will surely come

snippet.textDisplay:
Alright, so this video took me a while to watch fully, because i had to keep pausing to reflect.


First and foremost, thank you all. You're everything a fan could hope to be to a franchise. You've kept DB strong throughout a hiatus that would have killed most series forever. You showed us all why to love DB, for all its warts.


Second, don't worry about things so much. I never felt poorly informed (the opposite in fact, you guys had the update vids keeping me in the loop on what's going on). I always knew you guys were doing the best you could, and if things were slow it was because it was hard to get it done RIGHT. The quality of the material you guys put out always spoke to that.


I never felt like i was owed or promised a season 4, the end of episode 60 was a clear maybe, if we can? to me. So while it's sad that we don't get to enjoy more of the awesomeness that is DBZA, it's not a bolt out of the blue, or some unacceptable slight against us. Just keep making cool stuff like it, and i'll stick around to see more of it. Hope you guys do well, and get yourselves out of the blues you seem to be struggeling with right now.

snippet.textDisplay:
Well I saw the writing on the wall and unsubscribed when you put DBZ Abridged permanently on the back-burner and prioritized your other content while dangling DBZ Abridged in front of our noses with repeated broken promises of when the next episode would be available. The series went from having a new episode once per month to having a new episode once or twice per year. Your cancelling of Bojack Unbound Abridged and claiming you couldn’t make it funny further solidified for me that you guys just weren’t in it anymore.

Your fan base also bred a culture of bullying where nobody was allowed to complain about delays, and when anyone did they were pounced upon by other users who essentially told them that they weren’t allowed to complain because DBZ Abridged was free. I saw this happen on quite few videos and while admittedly I saw no one from TFS participate in this I also didn’t see anyone from TFS discourage this behavior. I ultimately feel like you guys never intended on continuing this series after the Cell Saga but promised that it would continue anyways for selfish reasons.

I was first introduced to TFS through Hellsing Ultimate Abridged back in 2016. Then, I watched FFVII: Machina Abridged. Once I was waiting for new episodes of both series to come out (the former is now completed and the latter soon to be too), I went to DBZA.

You guys were the reason I got back into DBZ. So thank you so much and cheers for all the laughs, the tears, and all those funny years. My heart is broken you won’t continue on with this project, but I understand and respect your decision. It pained me more to see how the burnout had an emotional toll on you both. 😢

I’m still a big fan of this channel, and will continue to support it because I know the amazing work you’ve done outside of DBZA. I look forward to more of your creative genius in the near future. Kudos to you, TFS! Keep up the great work! 😎

snippet.textDisplay: i was late into the dbza bandwagon because i very rarely got on the internet or youtube but it was thanks to yall that i made some great friends thru dbza.  i also understand burnout but not on a traditional sense like most youtubers but more on a creator kind of level. back in highschool i was apart of an art club hosted by the art teacher and we would have weekly deadlines for our content along with daily deadlines for average school work.  i also know about creative burnout first hand from the thousands of review scripts, research material etc for a show im planning on making here on youtube.  but that wont happen till i get a better computer that can handle basic recording software.  i will still report you not because of dbz but because i like your content and when i have an absolute crap day its your one liners that make my day better.  so keep doing what you want to do and if you feel like coming back to dbza then do so but don't rush it.  sometimes to get past a block or burnout is time.

snippet.textDisplay:
The benefits of working on something you love, the down side is the struggles that come up related to that. You guys did a really great job coming up with ideas and executing them. I personally am a weirdo that loves brainstorming, and seems to be able to power through tension (grew up in a family dynamic that's main way of communicating was a rather petty -.-). Anyway, I think this is part of what many people don't understand when it comes making all this creative content and just why there's SO many people in the credits of a media production. You get famous, and your story touches people, but it's expensive, time consuming and overwhelmingly stressful. Not only that you also can deal with crap from all sorts of drama, troublemakers and judgemental peeps and that stuff stick out like rusty nail, even within a crowd of praise and fulfillment at the end. That said, there are people who job is to help people navigation and help structure the process of a production so It's less stressful. Even though your ending all of this, if you ever look back at this, consider some french faces to help with production design, and think about all you achieved on top of that. Even if it was hard and tough know that you guys made something that became very famous, so famous that I think even Toriyama and Tori watch it and took some of things your guys pointed out in the story to heart in Super.

You guys did one hell of an amazing and highly professional job. Perhaps someday you guys will pick this back up again, figure out some ways to make it enjoyable again for you guys. Perhaps researching various idealization processes can help. I once listened to commentary from Brandon Sanderson and many creative authors talked about their creative process which the biggest thing they said was just zoning out helped with. In one of my classes we are currently reading "The Constructive Creative" which talks about idealization, brainstorming, human centered design, and ways to overcome a variety of creative struggles. It's too bad to see such a highly creative group of people put down such an amazing fan parody as it reached global popularity and fame. It can be really hard to come up with so much catchy brand "content" like "Ghost Nappa" or "Do do da do do ... I am chargin' my attack." Etc. Then you get to meet all these special big name people and make all these guest appearances. You made something so unique and well known and that is really hard to do. And I can't help but think that it's too bad you're putting that away. There are a lot of people whose life goal and constant struggle is make something that touches so many people. Story creation, even if you are working another's person story, is extremely hard, you guys did an amazing job. Anyway, if you guys ever want to look back at this production and pick it back up again, no one would be able to beat an abridged series of Naruto or Dragon Ball Super with all your guys amazing creative experience and skills. ( Ehehe I had been itching to say something about a good Naruto Shippuden Abridged series for a long time now. Forgive me for that)

snippet.textDisplay:
I can tell you guys are upset, but I want to tell you something.


DBZA got me into Dragonball. It got my MOM into Dragonball. Through DBZA, I found your Hellsing Abridged and got into Hellsing. Your eagerness to promote the official release has introduced a lot of people to amazing stories that they might not have otherwise experienced. And DBZA itself is an amazing story. I've watched through more times than I can count and there are still parts that punch me in the gut like it's the first time. Because you guys are amazing storytellers and actors. You've given us so much of yourselves FOR FREE, and I am so grateful that you dedicated so much of your time to this project.

I thought I'd be more upset about the end, but I'm really not. The videos will be up for whenever I want to come back. I still have loads of official release to catch up on. And if somewhere down the line you guys decide to return to it? Great! But I choose to remember DBZA and TFS as a gateway into so much more. Thank you for it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Wow, that's a lot to take in... but as a HUGE fan of DBZA (and i do mean that sincerely. i've forced at least a dozen people to sit down and start this series because of how much it means to me as an elegantly/hilariously crafted tribute to a show that shaped my childhood) i feel as though i can say that i represent at least a decent portion of your long-term fan base when i tell you this:

1. Thank you for the beautiful series that you have created, and for the countless hours that you have spent pouring your blood, sweat, tears, and god-only-knows what else into making it the best that it could be. I couldn't have asked for a better series. Yes, the writing, editing, animation, etc have evolved throughout the series, but it was apparent from the beginning that this was a project driven by passion for the source material. With that said...


2. What made DBZA so special was as much the source material as it was your collective talents in creating such a great series. Don't ever forget that. Even with DBZA ending, as long as you and your team keep putting your hearts into what you create, I (and so many other fans) KNOW that i will continue to enjoy your content for as long as you create it. There are few, if any, people that could have done what you did with DBZA, and that degree of talent and passion is worth recognizing.


3. I understand that this was a difficult decision, and your reasoning as stated in this video makes sense for a number of reasons. Even if it hurts some people that you have decided to conclude DBZA, just know this. There are so many of us that have grown to love you all as creators as much as we have grown to love DBZA, whether it be through your other series', your twitch streams, etc (personally i loved 'Sakero: Shadows Drink Twice' and your 'Shenmue' playthrough). So even with DBZA concluding, you all still mean a lot to us for your entire body of works. Nobody should ask you to jeopardize your channel, your employees/friends, or the quality of the series itself by pressuring you into continuing it when it all signs point to it being a bad decision.


I guess if i had to summarize, i would say this. i appreciate the transparency (a LOT), i respect your personal/financial/artistic decision, and i greatly look forward to whatever you do in the future. Whenever the bell notifies me, i'll be watching.


Sincerely, your fans
